needs_login: This device needs to be logged in to Tailscale. Refresh this page after logging in to view the status.
tailscale_disabled: Tailscale is currently disabled. It can be enabled via the Settings tab.

settings.unraid_listen: Unraid services listen on Tailscale IP

context.unraid_listen: Configures Unraid services (SSH, WebGUI, SMB, etc.) to listen on Tailscale addresses.
context.ip_forward: Sets net.ipv4.ip_forward and net.ipv6.conf.all.forwarding to 1 in sysctl. This change occurs immediately when being enabled.
context.taildrop: Specify the path for incoming Taildrop files.
context.dns: Allows Tailscale DNS to be enabled via the CLI or WebGUI. If disabled, Tailscale DNS will be disabled when Tailscale starts.
context.subnets: Allows Tailscale routes to be enabled via the CLI or WebGUI. If disabled, Tailscale routes will be disabled when Tailscale starts.
context.wireguard: Change the port used for Wireguard conections. This usually does not need to be changed.
context.erase: Logs out of Tailscale and resets all settings to defaults
context.restart: Restart the Tailscale daemon and reapply settings.
context.diagnostics: Download diagnostics (this may take some time to complete)
context.save: Tailscale will be restarted when changes are applied
context.reauthenticate: Force a Tailscale reauthentication. This will disconnect Tailscale until the authentication is completed.
context.funnel: Allows Tailscale funnel to be enabled via the WebGUI. If disabled, Tailscale funnel will be disabled.

info.exit_node_local: Allow LAN Access while using Exit Node

warnings.key_expiration: The Tailscale key will expire in %s days on %s.
warnings.netbios: NetBIOS is enabled in SMB settings - this can prevent shares from being accessed via Tailscale.
warnings.lock: The tailnet has lock enabled, but this node has not been signed. It will not be able to communicate with the tailnet.
warnings.funnel: Enabling Tailscale Funnel for the Unraid WebGUI exposes your server to the internet, significantly increasing the risk of unauthorized access and potential attacks. This feature should only be enabled if you fully understand the security impact. The recommended/secure approach for remote access is to install Tailscale on the devices you plan to use to access the WebGUI instead of enabling Funnel.
warnings.subnet: Accepting Tailscale subnets on your Unraid server can disrupt local network connectivity in certain network configurations. Accepting routes is not required for your Unraid server to function as a subnet router or exit node. Only enable this option if your Unraid server needs to connect to remote subnets advertised by other devices.
warnings.dns: Enabling Tailscale MagicDNS on your server can disrupt name resolution inside Docker containers, potentially causing connectivity issues for applications. MagicDNS does not need to be enabled on the server for you to access your Unraid server using MagicDNS names (e.g., 'unraid.tailnet.ts.net') from other devices.
warnings.caution: Proceed with caution and ensure you understand the implications of this change before continuing.

lock.signing_node: This is a signing node for the tailnet.
lock.signing_instructions: The following nodes are currently locked out of the tailnet. Check the box for any nodes you wish to add, then click the Sign button, to add the node to the tailnet.
lock.signed_node: Your tailnet has lock enabled and the current node is signed. This node can communicate with the tailnet.
lock.make_signing: If you wish to make this a signing node, you will need to trust the following key from a signing node:
lock.unsigned: Your tailnet has lock enabled and the current node is not signed. This node cannot communicate with the tailnet.
lock.unsigned_instructions: To allow this node to communicate, you will need to trust the following key from a signing node
lock.disabled: Your tailnet does not have lock enabled.
